intro: Banisteriopsis cachimbensis, commonly known as the Amazonian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Due to its potential medicinal properties, it has attracted interest in ethnobotanical research.
